message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing tasks such as summarization. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel model that combines the strengths of extractive and abstractive summarization, which is a common research area in cs.CL. 

The paper also involves the use of machine learning techniques, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

Furthermore, the paper involves the use of attention mechanisms, which is a common research area in cs.IR (Information Retrieval). 

Finally, the paper proposes a novel loss function, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), which deals with the development of new neural network architectures and optimization techniques.
